description: Louisiana Creole zydéco, compare French zarico; possibly from a pronunciation of French les haricots (“beans”) in a dance-tune title.

entries.meaning: A form of Louisiana Creole music, characteristically performed by accordion and washboard bands, that combines Cajun and Creole roots music with elements of African American music.
examples: Sunpie—in real life, a park ranger and an accordionist who leads a good zydeco band—taunted Harrison […].
